html:
Then flew —Isaiah is represented as standing out of the temple; the seraphim as in it.

Having a live coal —The Vulgate renders this, ‘A stone.’ This is, probably, the original meaning of the word; see1 Kings 19:6 . It at first denoted a hot stone which was used to roast meat upon. It may also mean a coal, from its resemblance to such a stone.

From off the altar —The altar of burnt-offering. This stood in the court of the priests, in front of the temple; see the notes atMatthew 21:12 . The fire on this altar was at first kindled by the Lord,Leviticus 9:24 , and was kept continually burning;Leviticus 6:12-13 .
